legal_news.title: UAE Enforces Mandatory Advertiser Permit for Social Media Promotions
legal_news.title_ar: الإمارات تفرض ترخيص المعلن الإلزامي لترويج وسائل التواصل الاجتماعي
legal_news.summary: Starting February 1, 2026, all individuals engaged in advertising on social media platforms must obtain a valid Advertiser Permit. The regulation applies to paid and unpaid promotions across all digital platforms.
key_points: Mandatory permit for all advertisers (citizens, residents, visitors)
Covers social media, websites, blogs, and digital platforms
Based on Federal Media Law No. 55 of 2023
Fines range from AED 5,000 to AED 1,000,000 for violations
Permit valid for 1 year (citizens/residents), 3 months (visitors)
First 3 years free for UAE citizens and residents
legal_news.legal_reference: Federal Media Law No. 55 of 2023, Cabinet Resolution No. 42 of 2025

legal_news.title: Dubai Unveils 2026-2028 Strategy to Strengthen Rule of Law
legal_news.title_ar: دبي تكشف عن استراتيجية 2026-2028 لتعزيز سيادة القانون
legal_news.summary: Dubai Government Legal Affairs Department unveiled its 2026-2028 strategy focusing on modernizing legal processes, integrating AI technology, and enhancing institutional performance.
key_points: Integration of AI in departmental operations and services
Strategic partnerships with relevant government entities
Empowerment of legal professional sector
Enhanced legal compliance for government entities
Training and qualification expansion
Real-time compliance monitoring systems
legal_news.legal_reference: Dubai Government Legal Affairs Department Strategic Plan 2026-2028
legal_news.spokesperson: Dr. Lowai Mohamed Belhoul, Director General

legal_news.title: UAE Civil Code Removes Gambling Provisions in Major Legal Reform
legal_news.title_ar: القانون المدني الإماراتي يلغي أحكام القمار في إصلاح قانوني كبير
legal_news.summary: UAE's new Civil Transactions Law removes all gambling-related provisions (Articles 1012-1021) from the civil code, signaling transition to specialized gaming regulations under GCGRA.
key_points: Federal Decree-Law No. 25 of 2025 replaces Federal Law No. 5 of 1985
Complete removal of gambling provisions (Articles 1012-1021)
Transition to specialized gaming regulatory framework
General Commercial Gaming Regulatory Authority (GCGRA) to oversee gaming
Potential amendments to Penal Code and Cyber Crimes Law
Part of UAE's regulatory modernization initiative

legal_news.title: Qatar Justice Minister Emphasizes Legal Reform for Sustainable Investment
legal_news.title_ar: وزير العدل القطري يؤكد على الإصلاح القانوني للاستثمار المستدام
legal_news.summary: Qatar's Justice Minister stated at Doha Legal Forum 2026 that clear legislation, independent judiciary, and efficient justice institutions are central to attracting sustainable investment.
key_points: Investment seeks trust before opportunity
Law as 'invisible infrastructure' for economic growth
Updates to investment law and companies law
Improved dispute resolution mechanisms
Digitalization of judicial services
Focus on digital economy, cross-border trade, international arbitration
Alignment with Qatar National Vision 2030
legal_news.spokesperson: HE Ibrahim bin Ali bin Issa al-Hassan al-Mohannadi, Justice Minister

legal_news.title: Qatar Proposes New PPP Law to Modernize Public-Private Partnerships
legal_news.title_ar: قطر تقترح قانون شراكة جديد لتحديث الشراكات بين القطاعين العام والخاص
legal_news.summary: Qatar is drafting an updated PPP law as part of broader legislative modernization, coordinated with foreign investment law and bankruptcy law reforms.
key_points: Part of comprehensive legislative modernization package
Coordinated with foreign investment law and bankruptcy law reforms
Aims to clarify procurement rules and risk allocation
Foreign investors can participate in 1,400+ commercial activities
Establishment of sector committees (industry, trade, logistics, health, tech)
Automatic tax number issuance with commercial registration
Environmental permit simplification
expected_impact: Enhanced foreign participation in PPP consortia

legal_news.title: Saudi Arabia Approves Regulations for Four Special Economic Zones
legal_news.title_ar: السعودية توافق على أنظمة أربع مناطق اقتصادية خاصة
legal_news.source: China Council for the Promotion of International Trade
legal_news.summary: Saudi Arabia approved exclusive regulations for four Special Economic Zones (SEZs) - Jazan, Ras Al-Khair, King Abdullah Economic City, and Cloud Computing & IT Zone - effective April 2026.
key_points: Four SEZs: Jazan, Ras Al-Khair, King Abdullah Economic City, Cloud Computing Zone
Regulations effective April 2026
Simplified licensing procedures
Flexible ownership structures
Attractive tax and customs frameworks
Multi-language commercial registration
Exemptions from certain traditional company law provisions
Tailored Saudization frameworks for each zone

sez_focus.Ras Al-Khair: Global maritime and mining hub, shipbuilding

legal_news.title: GCC Countries Implement Unified Labor Law Reforms for 2026
legal_news.title_ar: دول مجلس التعاون الخليجي تنفذ إصلاحات قانون العمل الموحدة لعام 2026
legal_news.summary: GCC member states (Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, UAE) implement harmonized labor law reforms, the region's first coordinated labor practice alignment.
key_points: Digital recordkeeping and e-contracts mandatory
All employment data must be uploaded to national e-portals
Remote and gig worker compliance frameworks established
Real-time or monthly wage and social insurance reporting
Enhanced localization and diversity requirements
Unified GCC digital work permit system
Stricter dependent visa rules tied to employment status
Shorter grace periods for sponsor transfers
legal_news.enforcement_agency: National labor ministries across GCC states

legal_news.title: Kuwait Cabinet Withdraws Nationality Certificates from Certain Persons
legal_news.title_ar: مجلس الوزراء الكويتي يسحب شهادات الجنسية من أشخاص معينين
legal_news.summary: Kuwait Cabinet Decision No. 23/2026 orders withdrawal of Kuwaiti nationality certificates from certain individuals.
key_points: Cabinet Decision No. 23/2026 dated 28/01/2026
Withdrawal of nationality certificates from specific persons
Part of nationality compliance enforcement

legal_news.title: Kuwait Approves Judicial Transfers and Arab Monetary Fund Subscription
legal_news.title_ar: الكويت توافق على النقل القضائي والاشتراك في صندوق النقد العربي
legal_news.summary: Kuwait issued multiple decrees including judicial transfers (Decree No. 10/2026) and approval of Arab Monetary Fund capital increase subscription (Decree-Law No. 7/2026).
key_points: Decree-Law No. 7/2026: Approval of Kuwait's subscription to AMF capital increase
Decree No. 9/2026: Promotion amendment (dated 20/01/2026)
Decree No. 10/2026: Judicial transfers (dated 26/01/2026)
legal_news.legal_reference: Kuwait Decree-Law No. 7/2026, Decree No. 9/2026, Decree No. 10/2026

legal_news.title: Oman Amends Work Permits and Introduces Occupational Injuries Regulation
legal_news.title_ar: عمان تعدل تصاريح العمل وتقدم نظام إصابات العمل
legal_news.summary: Oman issued two key ministerial decisions: amendments to work permit regulations and new occupational injuries and diseases regulation.
key_points: Ministerial Decision No. 44/2026: Amends work permit regulations
Amends provisions of Ministerial Decision No. 602/2025
Decision No. 1/2026: Issues Regulation for occupational injuries and diseases
Enhances worker protection framework
legal_news.legal_reference: Oman Ministerial Decision No. 44/2026, Oman Decision No. 1/2026

Streamlines housing dispute resolution process
